examples: Driving without a licence is an offence.
It's the third time that he's been convicted of a drug offence.

body_content.explanation: upset and hurt or annoyed feelings, often because someone has been rude or shown no respect:
examples: I really didn't mean (to cause/give) any offence (= did not intend to upset anyone) - I was just stating my opinion.
Do you think he took offence (= was upset) at what I said about his hair?

body_content.explanation: used when you say something that might upset or annoy someone :
examples: No offence, but I find your sister a little rude.
If you don't mind, I'd rather go on my own - no offence intended, but I think it would be better.

body_content.explanation: the part of a game such as American football that involves trying to score points, or the players who try to score points
